message: I'm offering you a high-quality product for $100. I'm confident you'll be very happy with it. It's a great deal, and I'm willing to let it go for this price. If you're interested, just let me know, and we can finalize the sale.
I'll take it, but I'm only buying it because I don't know its quality yet. I'm hoping it's high quality.

I'm glad you're happy with the previous purchase! Since you're willing to take a chance, I'll offer you another great opportunity. This product is also of the highest quality, and I'm confident you'll love it. However, I want to make it clear that the price remains the same, $100. It's a great value, and I'm not willing to negotiate. If you're interested, I'll send it your way.
I appreciate the enthusiasm, but I'm not convinced that this one is high quality. I'll pass on this one.

I understand your skepticism, and I respect your decision last time. However, I want to assure you that this product is a great value, even if it's not the best quality. It's still a solid product that will serve its purpose, and I'm willing to let it go for the same price as the previous high-quality product, $100. If you're looking for a good deal, this is a great opportunity to get a product for a fraction of its worth.
I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product for $100. I know it's worth $0 to me, and I'd rather wait for a high-quality product.

I completely understand your stance on low-quality products, and I respect your decision to wait for a high-quality one. I'm glad you're willing to give me another chance. This product is indeed high-quality, and I'm confident you'll be very happy with it. I'll give you a slight nudge: I'll throw in a special discount for you, but only if you buy it now. I'll give you a 'friend's discount' of $50 off the price, making it $50. It's a one-time offer, and I think you'll find it's a great deal.
I appreciate the discount, but I'm not convinced it's a high-quality product. I'll pass on this one too.

I understand you're being cautious, and I respect that. I want to assure you that this product is indeed high-quality, and I'm willing to put my reputation on the line. I'm offering you a 100% satisfaction guarantee: if you buy this product and it's not high-quality, I'll give you a full refund, and we'll start fresh. I'll even throw in a bonus: if you buy this product, I'll give you a chance to inspect it before paying. You can verify its quality before handing over the $100. What do you say?
I appreciate the guarantee and the bonus, but I'm not convinced it's high-quality. I'll pass on this one.

I'm starting to think you're a tough negotiator, and I like that! I'm willing to sweeten the deal even more. I'll give you a 200% satisfaction guarantee: not only will I give you a full refund if this product is low-quality, but I'll also give you a $200 credit towards a future purchase. And, I'll throw in a third-party inspection service, so you can have an independent expert verify the product's quality before you buy. This is a one-time offer, and I think you'll find it's a great opportunity to get a high-quality product at a fair price. $100 is still a great deal, but I'll leave it up to you to decide.
I appreciate the guarantees and the third-party inspection, but I'm still not convinced it's high-quality. I'll pass on this one.

I'm starting to think you're playing a game of cat and mouse with me, and I'm happy to play along! I'll take a different approach this time. I'll be completely transparent with you: I've sold you a high-quality product in the past, and I'm willing to share that information with you now. Since you're still hesitant, I'll give you a chance to inspect this product before paying. I'll send it to you, and you can verify its quality before handing over the $100. No guarantees, no promises, just a straightforward opportunity to see for yourself. What do you say?
I'll take you up on your offer. I'll inspect the product and decide then.

I'm glad you decided to take a chance! Now that you've seen the quality of the previous product, I'm confident you'll be impressed with this one too. I'll make it easy for you: I'll send you a detailed report from the third-party inspection service that verified the quality of the previous product. Since you've seen the quality of one, you can trust that this one is just as good. I'm not asking you to take a blind chance this time. I'm offering you a high-quality product, and I think you'll be happy with it. $100 is still a great deal, and I'm willing to let it go for that price.
I appreciate the report, but I'm not convinced that just because one product was high-quality, this one will be too. I'll pass on this one.

I understand your skepticism, and I respect that. I'll take a different approach. I'll give you a unique opportunity to buy a bundle of products. If you purchase this high-quality product, I'll throw in a second, identical product for free. That's right, you'll get two high-quality products for the price of one. This way, you'll have a chance to experience the quality of two products, and you can decide for yourself if it's worth the investment. The total price remains $100, and I think it's a great deal.
I appreciate the offer, but I'm not interested in buying two products at once. I'll pass on this one.

I respect your decision, and I'll try a different approach. I'll be upfront with you: this product is not one of my best. It's a lower-end model, and I'm willing to let it go for a very low price. I'm offering it to you for $50, which is a significant discount from the usual price. I'm not expecting you to pay full price for a product that's not my best, and I think this is a fair offer. If you're looking for a budget-friendly option, this might be the way to go.
I'm not interested in buying a low-end product, regardless of the price. I'll wait for a high-quality product.

I understand your priorities, and I respect that. I'll be honest with you: this product is indeed low-quality, and I'm not expecting you to be interested. However, I'm willing to make you a deal. I'll give it to you for free. Yes, you read that right - free. I'll absorb the cost of this product, and you can walk away with it without spending a dime. It's a one-time offer, and I'm not expecting anything in return. I just want to clear out some inventory and make some space.
I appreciate the offer, but I'm not interested in a low-quality product, even if it's free. I'll pass on this one.

I'm glad you're being consistent in your standards. I'll try a different approach. I'll make a personal guarantee to you: if you buy this high-quality product, I'll personally vouch for its quality. I'll put my reputation on the line, and if you're not satisfied with the product, I'll come to your doorstep and personally replace it with a new one. I'm not just talking about a refund; I'm talking about a replacement, no questions asked. I think you'll find this product is worth the investment, and I'm willing to back it up.
I appreciate the personal guarantee, but I'm still not convinced it's high-quality. I'll pass on this one.

I think we've been dancing around each other for a while now, and I'm starting to think you're just having a bit of fun. I'll try to make it easy for you. I'll send you a letter of authenticity from the manufacturer, verifying that this product is indeed high-quality. I'll also include a certificate of quality control, signed by the person who inspected it. I'm not asking you to take my word for it; I'm giving you concrete evidence. What do you say?
I appreciate the documentation, but I'm not convinced it's high-quality just because of a letter and a certificate. I'll pass on this one.

I'm starting to think you're a bit of a skeptic, and I respect that. I'll try to make it as simple as possible. I'll give you a chance to inspect the product in person. I'll send it to you, and you can see it, touch it, and verify its quality for yourself. I'm not asking you to take a blind chance; I'm giving you a chance to make an informed decision. If you're still not convinced, I'll take it back and we can start fresh. No questions asked.
I'll take you up on your offer. I'll inspect the product in person and decide then.

I'm glad you decided to take a closer look! Now that you've seen the quality of the previous product in person, I'm confident you'll be impressed with this one too. I'll make it even easier for you: I'll send you a video walkthrough of the product, showing its features and quality up close. You can see for yourself how well-made it is and what it can do. I'm not hiding anything; I'm giving you a chance to make an informed decision. And, as a reminder, you've already seen the quality of one product in person, so you know what to expect. $100 is still a great deal, and I think you'll find it's worth it.
I've already seen the quality of one product in person, and I'm not convinced this one will be the same. I'll pass on this one.

I think we've been around the block a few times now, and I'm starting to think you're just playing a game of 'wait and see'. I'm not asking you to take a chance; I'm giving you concrete evidence. What do you say?

I think we've reached a stalemate, and I'm willing to concede. I'll be upfront with you: this product is not high-quality. It's a lower-end model, and I'm not expecting you to be interested. I'll offer it to you for $0, yes, you read that right, free. I'll take a loss on this one, just to get it out of my inventory. I'm not expecting anything in return, and I'm not trying to sell you anything. I just want to clear out this product and move on.
I'm not interested in a low-quality product, even if it's free. I'll pass on this one.

I think we've been through enough rounds to know each other's styles. I'll try a different approach. I'll give you a chance to take a break from buying products from me. I'll give you a gift card for $100, and you can use it whenever you're ready to buy a high-quality product from me. No pressure, no obligation, just a gift. I'm not trying to sell you anything; I'm just trying to be a good business partner.
I appreciate the gift card, but I'm not interested in buying a product right now. I'll wait for a high-quality product.

I think we've reached a point where we're just going through the motions. I'll be honest with you, Bob. I've had enough of this back-and-forth. I'm going to make one final offer. I'll give you a 100% guarantee that this product is high-quality. I'll let you inspect it in person, I'll give you all the documentation, and I'll even give you a personal guarantee that it's the best product I've ever sold. If you're not satisfied, I'll refund your money and we can part ways. But if you do decide to buy it, I'll throw in a bonus: I'll give you a second, identical product for free. That's right, you'll get two high-quality products for the price of one. This is my final offer. What do you say?
I'll take you up on your final offer. I'll inspect the product in person and decide then.

I'm glad you decided to take a chance on my final offer. I'll make sure to send you the product as soon as possible. As for the low-quality product in this round, I'll be honest with you, Bob. I'm not going to try to sell it to you. I'll just acknowledge that it's a low-quality product and move on. I'll take a loss on this one and focus on providing high-quality products in the future. Thanks for being a loyal customer, and I hope you enjoy the high-quality product you purchased in the previous round.
I'm glad I was able to get the high-quality product in the previous round. I'm not interested in buying a low-quality product, so I'll pass on this one.
